title: Condensed Serif
content:
Hi Team-  
So I'm trying to match this period serif as closely as possible. That 'J' is giving me a lot of grief. Any suggestions would be really appreciated!

Thanks, as always.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Condensed%20Serif_3730.png)
author: malbright

comments.content:
Only alternatives for the moment and far from being close unfortunately: [Bordeaux](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/bordeaux-roman), [Torino Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/www.fonts.com/font/monotype-imaging/torino/condensed), [Onyx](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/onyx), [Bodoni Poster Compressed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/www.fonts.com/font/adobe/bodoni-poster/compressed), [Fashion Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/fashion-didot), [Moderno FB](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/www.fontbureau.com/newspaper/fonts/ModernoFB), [Arsis](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/arsis), [Ambroise](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/typofonderie.com/fonts/ambroise-family) François, Ian Party's [GRAZIA](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/swisstypefaces.com/type-services/exclusive-typefaces/grazia) and [L'OFFICIEL](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/swisstypefaces.com/type-services/exclusive-typefaces/officiel-paris) (with Maxime Buechi), [Stiletto](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353/http:/www.stephaneelbaz.com/) bespoke typeface for Stiletto magazine by Stéphane Elbaz,  
As usual, do you have any complementary information (origin, website, magazine...)?

Sadly I have almost no information, other than this is from a piece of stock...the cover for some sheet music.  
Thank you though for the suggestions!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sheet%20music_5155.jpg)

Looks like a photo service [shutterstock] image of a circa 1900 or earlier sheet music cover. Whole thing might have been lithographed or engraved. Image is pretty small but I perhaps detect some variation in the upper portion of E.  
Anyway, no digital match that I can see.  
Sans is also unusual.  
Don
